required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Cabazitaxel Combined With Prednisone and Prophylaxis of Neutropenia Complications in the Treatment of Patients With Metastatic Castration-resistant Prostate Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IV, Multicenter, National, Non-comparative, Open-label Study of Cabazitaxel, Combined With Prednisone and Prophylaxis of Neutropenia Complications in the Second-line Treatment of Patients With Metastatic Castration-resistant Prostate Cancer and After Failure of Docetaxel-based Chemotherapy. Descriptive Assessment of the Circulating Tumor Cells in This Context.

detailed_description.textblock: Screening: 15 days Treatment: until disease progression Post-treatment Follow-up: 12 months

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with some episode of neutropenia classified as grade ≥ 3

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with episode of neutropenia grade ≥3

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 42, Day 84, Day 126 and End of Treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in score derived from the Functional assessment of cancer therapy-prostate (FACT-P) and the Trial Outcome Index (TOI)
Number of patients with adverse events

arm_group.description: 25 mg/m2, administered as a 1-hour intravenous infusion, on Day 1 of each cycle, every 21 days Prednisone: 10 mg daily throughout the treatment with cabazitaxel Ciprofloxacin: at a dose of 500 mg for 8 days twice daily (total dose 1.0 g) Granulocyte-Colony Stimulating Factors: maximum dose of 600ug for 7 days or until Absolute Neutrophils Count reaches level ≥ 10.000/mm3

intervention.description: Pharmaceutical form: solution Route of administration: intravenous
Pharmaceutical form: tablet Route of administration: oral
Pharmaceutical form: tablet Route of administration: oral
Pharmaceutical form: solution Route of administration: subcutaneous
